byline.contributor: Susan Abad contributed reporting from Bogotá, Colombia.

lead_paragraph: Colombia’s largest guerrilla group halted a unilateral cease-fire after government forces killed 26 rebel fighters, dealing the latest setback to talks aimed at ending over 50 years of war.

headline.print_headline: Colombia Rebels End Truce After a Government Attack
headline.main: Colombia Rebels End Truce After a Government Attack

snippet: Colombia’s largest guerrilla group halted a unilateral cease-fire after government forces killed 26 rebel fighters, dealing the latest setback to talks aimed at ending over 50 years of war.
abstract: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia, or FARC, suspend unilateral cease-fire after Colombian forces attack FARC encampment in Cauca, resulting in deaths of 26 rebel fighters.
